title.rendered: Abrams for Governor, Stacey Abrams, and One Georgia Committee Sue for Equal Fundraising Playing Field

content.rendered:
Law Signed by Kemp Gives Incumbent Unconstitutional Fundraising Advantage

ATLANTA — Today, Abrams for Governor, Stacey Abrams, and One Georgia, the leadership committee registered by Abrams last week, filed a lawsuit against Attorney General Chris Carr and the members of the Georgia Government Transparency and Campaign Finance Commission. The case, filed in the United States District Court for the Northern District of Georgia, seeks to stop Brian Kemp’s exclusive and unconstitutional fundraising advantage the incumbent governor granted himself by signing SB 221 last year.

“Brian Kemp signed legislation giving himself exclusive access to a special fundraising committee, and he’s already raised millions of dollars into it. Our campaign should have that same access,” the Abrams campaign said in a message to supporters today.

Documents relating to the case, including the complaint and temporary restraining order, can be found here.

The Complaint asks the court to declare that the leadership committee statute as applied violates the First and Fourteenth Amendments to the United States Constitution and to prevent the irreparable injury that would result from an unequal playing field. As the AJC reports, the leadership committee law signed by Kemp was “designed to help Gov. Brian Kemp and top lawmakers.”

Plaintiffs’ motion for Temporary Restraining Order (TRO) calls out Kemp and his allies for passing a campaign finance scheme “transparently motivated by the desire of the incumbent Governor and his allies to leverage his legal advantage against those who would challenge his continued reign.” The TRO cites Perdue v. Kemp, a case dubiously argued and lost by Kemp, with the TRO asking for “all declared and qualified candidates [be] subject to the same contribution limits.”

All documents pertaining to the case can be found here. 

Documents include:

  • Exhibit A, an affidavit from Nikema Williams, Chair of the Democratic Party of Georgia, stating that Stacey Abrams is the Democratic nominee for governor.
  • Exhibit B, correspondence of the days-long efforts of Abrams’ One Georgia committee to confirm that the the Georgia Government Transparency and Campaign Finance Commission will not reject its registration
  • Abrams Campaign Manager Lauren Groh-Wargo’s declaration in support of the Complaint and TRO
  • A proposed order for the Court

###
